<Irish measure
1:
--------------------
<Text: Irish measure:  The units were based on "English measure" but used a linear perch measuring 7 yard as opposed to the English rod of 5.5 yard .
Triplets:<Irish measure
2:
--------------------
Text: Irish measure:
Thus, linear units such as the furlong and mile, which were defined in terms of perches, were longer by a factor of 14:11 (~27% more) in Irish measure, while areas such as the rood or acre were larger by 196:121 (~62% more).
Triplets:<linear units
